11#ifndef MODULES_PACING_TASK_QUEUE_PACED_SENDER_H_
12#define MODULES_PACING_TASK_QUEUE_PACED_SENDER_H_
13
14#include <stddef.h>
15#include <stdint.h>
16
17#include <functional>
18#include <memory>
19#include <queue>
20#include <vector>
21
22#include "absl/types/optional.h"
23#include "api/sequence_checker.h"
24#include "api/task_queue/task_queue_factory.h"
25#include "api/units/data_size.h"
26#include "api/units/time_delta.h"
27#include "api/units/timestamp.h"
28#include "modules/include/module.h"
29#include "modules/pacing/pacing_controller.h"
30#include "modules/pacing/rtp_packet_pacer.h"
31#include "modules/rtp_rtcp/source/rtp_packet_to_send.h"
32#include "rtc_base/synchronization/mutex.h"
33#include "rtc_base/task_queue.h"
34#include "rtc_base/thread_annotations.h"
35
36namespace webrtc {
37class Clock;
38class RtcEventLog;
39
40class TaskQueuePacedSender : public RtpPacketPacer, public RtpPacketSender {
41 public:
42 // The |hold_back_window| parameter sets a lower bound on time to sleep if
43 // there is currently a pacer queue and packets can't immediately be
44 // processed. Increasing this reduces thread wakeups at the expense of higher
45 // latency.
46 // TODO(bugs.webrtc.org/10809): Remove default value for hold_back_window.
47 TaskQueuePacedSender(
48 Clock* clock,
49 PacingController::PacketSender* packet_sender,
50 RtcEventLog* event_log,
51 const WebRtcKeyValueConfig* field_trials,
52 TaskQueueFactory* task_queue_factory,
53 TimeDelta hold_back_window = PacingController::kMinSleepTime);
54
55 ~TaskQueuePacedSender() override;
56
57 // Ensure that necessary delayed tasks are scheduled.
58 void EnsureStarted();
59
60 // Methods implementing RtpPacketSender.
61
62 // Adds the packet to the queue and calls
63 // PacingController::PacketSender::SendPacket() when it's time to send.
64 void EnqueuePackets(
65 std::vector<std::unique_ptr<RtpPacketToSend>> packets) override;
66
67 // Methods implementing RtpPacketPacer:
68
69 void CreateProbeCluster(DataRate bitrate, int cluster_id) override;
70
71 // Temporarily pause all sending.
72 void Pause() override;
73
74 // Resume sending packets.
75 void Resume() override;
76
77 void SetCongestionWindow(DataSize congestion_window_size) override;
78 void UpdateOutstandingData(DataSize outstanding_data) override;
79
80 // Sets the pacing rates. Must be called once before packets can be sent.
81 void SetPacingRates(DataRate pacing_rate, DataRate padding_rate) override;
82
83 // Currently audio traffic is not accounted for by pacer and passed through.
84 // With the introduction of audio BWE, audio traffic will be accounted for
85 // in the pacer budget calculation. The audio traffic will still be injected
86 // at high priority.
87 void SetAccountForAudioPackets(bool account_for_audio) override;
88
89 void SetIncludeOverhead() override;
90 void SetTransportOverhead(DataSize overhead_per_packet) override;
91
92 // Returns the time since the oldest queued packet was enqueued.
93 TimeDelta OldestPacketWaitTime() const override;
94
95 // Returns total size of all packets in the pacer queue.
96 DataSize QueueSizeData() const override;
97
98 // Returns the time when the first packet was sent;
99 absl::optional<Timestamp> FirstSentPacketTime() const override;
100
101 // Returns the number of milliseconds it will take to send the current
102 // packets in the queue, given the current size and bitrate, ignoring prio.
103 TimeDelta ExpectedQueueTime() const override;
104
105 // Set the max desired queuing delay, pacer will override the pacing rate
106 // specified by SetPacingRates() if needed to achieve this goal.
107 void SetQueueTimeLimit(TimeDelta limit) override;
108
109 protected:
110 // Exposed as protected for test.
111 struct Stats {
112 Stats()
113 : oldest_packet_wait_time(TimeDelta::Zero()),
114 queue_size(DataSize::Zero()),
115 expected_queue_time(TimeDelta::Zero()) {}
116 TimeDelta oldest_packet_wait_time;
117 DataSize queue_size;
118 TimeDelta expected_queue_time;
119 absl::optional<Timestamp> first_sent_packet_time;
120 };
121 virtual void OnStatsUpdated(const Stats& stats);
122
123 private:
124 // Check if it is time to send packets, or schedule a delayed task if not.
125 // Use Timestamp::MinusInfinity() to indicate that this call has _not_
126 // been scheduled by the pacing controller. If this is the case, check if
127 // can execute immediately otherwise schedule a delay task that calls this
128 // method again with desired (finite) scheduled process time.
129 void MaybeProcessPackets(Timestamp scheduled_process_time);
130
131 void MaybeUpdateStats(bool is_scheduled_call) RTC_RUN_ON(task_queue_);
132 Stats GetStats() const;
133
134 Clock* const clock_;
135 const TimeDelta hold_back_window_;
136 PacingController pacing_controller_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_);
137
138 // We want only one (valid) delayed process task in flight at a time.
139 // If the value of |next_process_time_| is finite, it is an id for a
140 // delayed task that will call MaybeProcessPackets() with that time
141 // as parameter.
142 // Timestamp::MinusInfinity() indicates no valid pending task.
143 Timestamp next_process_time_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_);
144
145 // Since we don't want to support synchronous calls that wait for a
146 // task execution, we poll the stats at some interval and update
147 // |current_stats_|, which can in turn be polled at any time.
148
149 // True iff there is delayed task in flight that that will call
150 // UdpateStats().
151 bool stats_update_scheduled_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_);
152 // Last time stats were updated.
153 Timestamp last_stats_time_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_);
154
155 // Indicates if this task queue is started. If not, don't allow
156 // posting delayed tasks yet.
157 bool is_started_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_) = false;
158
159 // Indicates if this task queue is shutting down. If so, don't allow
160 // posting any more delayed tasks as that can cause the task queue to
161 // never drain.
162 bool is_shutdown_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(task_queue_);
163
164 mutable Mutex stats_mutex_;
165 Stats current_stats_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(stats_mutex_);
166
167 rtc::TaskQueue task_queue_;
168};
169} // namespace webrtc
170#endif // MODULES_PACING_TASK_QUEUE_PACED_SENDER_H_
171
